title: Strategies for Improving Learning Engagement and Outcomes in Hybrid Social Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic social education theories and practical experience
context.additional_context: Focuses on strengthening adaptability to hybrid learning environments and acquiring interaction strategies in social education for in-service elementary school teachers

learning_goals: Learners can apply and utilize three techniques (real-time feedback, digital collaboration tools, interaction-promoting questioning methods) to enhance participation in synchronous classes in a hybrid environment.
Learners can analyze participation differences between on-site/remote learners and propose at least two instructional design plans to maximize interaction opportunities.
Learners can create microlearning content that simultaneously achieves conceptual understanding (over 80%) and affective engagement (survey score of 4/5 or higher) using mobile devices.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
